column4: is there nowhere I can go to figure out how to support my new monitor?  Or am I just just screwed because hardware is a gamble with linux?
have you even mentioned what gfx card you're running?
then you should start looking in that area, "how do I get multiple monitor support on my ATI card".

i'm not looking for multiple mointor support i only have one 1080p monitor that i want to use i was trying to get it working as a second monitor from using my old 19" 3:4 as a failsafe because ubuntu flaked on me
sorry, no experience with ATI for me.
i'm pretty sure it's not an ATI issue but okay
so how far does the monitor work in the bootup process?
are you sure about that 173Mhz? seems excessive?
no i thought that was retarded to but that's what cvt says....furthermore it's NOT 173...it's 60
and this is via vga, not hdmi/dvi ?
and you don't have DVI? In my experience EDID usually works on DVI
look here http://www.mythtv.org/wiki/Modeline_Database and try some of those modelines
spend another 10USD for a DVI cable and you'll get better picture and easier to get it to work.
my 1920x1200 monitor was detected automatically, no problem at all.
whatever, DVI, HDMI, whatever connectors work for you.
ok then, you seem to know best. Have a nice life.
